description: This table stores information about the procedures linked to the timeout.

columns.name: RECORD_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the timeout record.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: CM_CT_OWNER_ID
columns.description: The Community ID (CID) of the instance that owns this contact. This is only populated if you use IntraConnect.

columns.name: LINK_PROC_SURG_ID
columns.description: Stores the primary surgeon for a procedure linked to a timeout.

columns.name: LINK_PROC_LAT_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores the laterality of the linked procedure.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Left


Right


Bilateral


N/A


Default

columns.name: LINK_PROC_ORP_ID
columns.description: Stores a pointer to the procedure record that is linked to the timeout.

columns.name: LINK_PROC_ORP_ID_PROC_NAME
columns.description: The name of the surgical procedure record.

columns.name: LINK_PROC_PNL_NUM
columns.description: Stores the panel number of the linked procedure.

columns.name: LINK_PROC_FREE_TEXT
columns.description: Stores the free-text name of the linked procedure when the timeout was documented. This prevents later changes in the procedure's free-text name from altering the meaning of the timeout.
